txt.en: 'You may have bested my men, but you're no match for me!'
'When Saruman sent us to the Hornburg, I deserted the White Hand.'
'On your feet! Sharkey wants this one alive!'
'Several of my kind followed me, and I came to disguise myself as Sharkey.'
'My deception gave us a higher standing than Saruman had, and so we let the ruffians believe what they wanted.'
'But, I suppose that is finished now....'
'Before I deserted, I served Saruman in the mines beneath Orthanc.'
'It seemed Saruman's Uruk-hai had taken to calling him 'sharkû'.'
'As time wore on, Saruman grew fond of their nickname for him.'
'It was then he began to call himself 'Sharkey'.'
'Perhaps he misheard the Uruk-hai, or perhaps he just liked 'Sharkey' more.'
'After all, 'sharkû' just means 'old man' in the Orkish tongue.'
'That is the truth of it. Tell your wizard I will leave the Gladden Fields.'
